subject: PRE-MARKET AUSTRALIAN, JAPANESE AND SOUTH KOREAN STOCK NEWS: WTI crude futures rose to briefly above USD 69/bbl
content:
AUSTRALIA

Base Resources (BSE AT)
- Co. FY18 net AUD 34mln vs. Prev. AUD 15.8mln Y/Y. (Newswires)

G8 Education (GEM AT)
- Co. H1 underlying net AUD 25.6mln vs. Prev. AUD 33.7mln Y/Y. (Newswires)

NAB (NAB AT)
- Co. expects to be made accountable for any criminal offences but is said to disagree with some of the allegations made at the royal commission. (The Australian)

Reliance Worldwide Corp (RWC AT)
- Co. FY18 net AUD 66.0mln vs. Prev. AUD 65.6mln Y/Y, EBITDA rose 25% Y/Y, rev. rose 27.9% Y/Y. (Newswires)

Spark Infrastructure (SKI AT)
- Co. H1 net rose 18.9% Y/Y to AUD 58.1mln. (New3swires)

Other News
- Australian PM Morrison was sworn in as PM on Friday, while he also announced his cabinet over the weekend in which Liberal Party deputy leader Frydenberg was named as Treasurer and Cormann retained Finance Minister role. (Newswires)

Energy
- WTI crude futures gained on Friday and briefly broke above USD 69.00/bbl. (Newswires)

JAPAN

Fast Retailing (9983 JT)
- Co. is said to plan more Uniqlo stores for the Nordic region. (Newswires)

Rohm (3893 JT)
- Co. is planning to invest JPY 240bln during 3 years on Electric Vehicles. (Newswires)

Sharp (6753 JT)
- Mizuho Financial Group (8411 JT) is to acquire 6.87% stake in the Co. today. (Newswires)

Toyota (6702 JT)
- Co. is to set up a plant in China for electrics. (Nikkei)

Other News
- Japanese PM Abe declared candidacy for LDP leadership elections as expected, while polls showed that cabinet approval rating rose 3 points to 48%. (Newswires)

SOUTH KOREA

Samsung Electronics (005930 KS)
- Co. is to begin Galaxy Watch sales in South Korea this week. (Yonhap)

GS Group
- The conglomerate has earmarked investment of KRW 20tln over half a decade to foster new growth businesses and expand presence abroad. (Yonhap)

Other News
- US President Trump asked Secretary of State Pompeo not to go to North Korea at this time as he feels they are not making significant progress on denuclearisation of the peninsula. Trump was also said to not believe China is helping with the process of denuclearisation and added that Pompeo looks forward to going to North Korea in the near future which most likely will be after US trading relationship with China 'is resolved'. (Newswires)

subject: China export growth in H2 may slow to about 2%, according to reports in China Securities Journal
ASIAN DAILY ECONOMIC RELEASES CALENDAR NOW AVAILABLE IN THE RESEARCH SECTION: Highlights Include Light calendar with only Chinese Industrial Profits scheduled for release
DAILY ASIA-PAC OPENING NEWS
content:
ASIA

PBoC resumed the use of counter-cyclical factor in the CNY midpoint-fixing mechanism, according to sources. (Newswires)


UK/EU

Reports noted that UK and EU are to agree to push back its Brexit agreement deadline by 4 weeks to a ‘hard deadline’ in mid-November. (Telegraph)

Irish Foreign Minister Coveney stated that it is ‘very, very unlikely’ there will be a no-deal Brexit. (Newswires)  

FX

BoC Governor Poloz commented that a gradual approach to monetary policy is appropriate amid digital disruption, while Poloz had previously commented that inflation is very close to target, that the rise is transitory and the outlook is for higher rates. (Newswires)
 

COMMODITIES

Baker Hughes Rig Count: oil rigs -9 at 860, gas rigs -4 at 182, total rigs -13 to 1044; US drillers cut most oil rigs since May 2016. (Newswires)

Iran’s Oil Minister Zanganeh said some members are interpreting the latest OPEC decision on oil output differently and are acting in accordance with policies of the US. (Newswires)
 

GEOPOLITICAL

US President Trump asked Secretary of State Pompeo not to go to North Korea at this time as he feels they are not making significant progress on denuclearisation of the peninsula. Trump was also said to not believe China is helping with the process of denuclearisation and added that Pompeo looks forward to going to North Korea in the near future which most likely will be after US trading relationship with China 'is resolved'. (Newswires)

US sanctions against Russian related to the nerve agent attack are to go into effect on Monday according to a Federal statement, while there were also comments from US President Trump's Adviser Bolton that US sanctions against Russia to remain in place until Russia changes its behaviour. Elsewhere, reports noted that Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny was detained in Moscow. (Newswires)
 

US

Fed Chair Powell (neutral) stated that further interest rate hikes are likely appropriate if strong income and job growth continue, while he also stated that gradual rate hikes navigate risks of going too slowly vs. too fast and noted no clear signs of inflation accelerating above 2%. (Newswires)

Fed's Mester (voter, hawk) said Q3 has come in strong so far and that gradual hikes seems appropriate, while she also stated the case for raising interest rates is "pretty compelling". (Newswires)

Fed's Kaplan (non-voter, dovish) repeated the Fed should move rates towards neutral and that he sees 3-4 rate hikes in the next 9-12 months, while he also emphasized gradual rate hikes. (Newswires)

US President Trump tweeted that a trade deal with Mexico could be reached soon, while there were separate reports which noted that US and Mexico were said to be poised for an agreement on NAFTA as soon as this Monday. In addition, there were comments from Mexico Economy Minister Guajardo that sides were practically in the final hours of negotiations which was an improvement of tone in comparison to source reports on Friday that Mexican President Elect Lopez Obrador’s stance on oil was said to be keeping US and Mexico from securing a NAFTA deal. (Newswires)

US GOP Senator McCain passed away over the weekend, while Arizona Governor Ducey will have to choose who will fill the vacancy from the Republican Party until a special election is conducted in 2020. (CNN)
 

MARKET RECAP

Autodesk Inc (ADSK) was one of the day’s biggest gainers following its Q2 earnings where it beat expectations on the top and bottom lines. On the flip side, Foot Locker Inc (FL) edged lower; although earnings beat expectations, SSS missed coming in at +0.5% vs Exp. +0.7%; other retailers also lagged behind with names like Gap (GPS), Macy’s (M) and Kroger (KR) all down on the day. Netflix (NFLX) surged more than 4% after an upgrade at Suntrust and similarly Mylan (MYL) posted gains following an upgrade Evercore. Philip Morris (PM) however dipped lower on a downgrade at Jefferies. Papa John’s (PZZA) spiked higher following reports it had attained Bank of America (BAC) and Lazard (LAZ) as financial advisors. In M&A Enbridge (ENB) announced it is to acquire all of Spectra Energy Partners’ (SEP) public equity for USD 3.3bln transaction. Elsewhere, China Biologic (CBPO) dropped significantly when CITIC Capital MB Investment Limited withdrew its preliminary acquisition proposal.

There was decent volume in the Treasury complex, as Jackson Hole got underway. Powell’s comments were judged to be on the dovish side, which helped 10s catch a bid; Informa reported that traders priced in a pause after two more hikes, and then the real money bid came back forcing poorly placed shorts to cover. Unsurprisingly, curves continued to flatten with 2s10s and 2s30s finding their customary cyclical narrows. US 10-year T-notes settled 2+ tick lower at 120-16+.

subject: News poll suggests that Australia's opposition Labor Party has increased lead in poll after the recent leadership change in the ruling Liberal Party
ASIA-PAC SERVICE IS NOW LIVE FOR TODAY'S SESSION
